question: Chemical reactions involve a transfer of heat energy. measured in what?

nodes.text: Amps are a unit used to measure electrical current, not heat energy transferred in chemical reactions.
Amperes are used to measure the transfer of heat energy in chemical reactions.
Thermals are measurements of heat energy transferred in chemical reactions.
Joules are the unit used to measure heat energy transferred in chemical reactions.
